fields.planned_diversity_expenditures: Endeavor Health Is Actively Seeking Supplier Diversity Within Purchases For Capital Equipment, General And Subcontracted Services, Material Suppliers, Service Providers And Consultants. For Each Rfp That We Solicit From The Vendor Community We Strive To Include Diverse Suppliers, If Available. If We Are Using A General Contractor For A Construction Project We Outline Expectations Related To Diverse Supplier Utilization IN Initial Bid Requests And Seek Feedback And Vendor Recommendations From Our Contractor Teams. We Do Not Have Goals For Specific Diversity Spend Requirements IN Each Category And Are IN The Earlier Stages Of Developing These Goals For Our System.
fields.plan_for_diversity_recruitment: Invitations To Bid Alert Prospective Vendors Of Our Diversity Participation Goals. We Strive To Incorporate This IN All Projects As Awareness Of Goals Has Already Increased Participation. We Are Actively Using Supplier Gateway And Published That To The Vendor Community.
fields.challenges_to_diversity_recruitment: Due To The Nature Of Construction Projects Executed Within The Healthcare Environment, Only Experienced Contractors Are Considered To Perform Work Within These Sensitive Environments. With The Current State Of The Chicagoland Market And High Diversity Requirements IN Many Large Competing Projects, Most Qualified Labor Has Been Engaged IN These Projects Making Them Unavailable OR Unfavorable Economically. We Are Seeing Some General Contractors Employing Inexperienced Diverse Vendors And Helping Them To Gain Experience IN Larger Projects, This Has Been Beneficial. Capital Equipment Is Generally Selected By Clinicians With Familiarity With The Equipment And Many Large Vendors Have Strong Relationships With Clinicians. Most Diverse Suppliers Costs Incrementally More Than Non Diverse Suppliers. With Our Margin Being So Meager As An Organization We Have To Find The Win/Win Solutions Where A Diverse Suppliers Can Be A Lower Cost Provider And Help The Community.
fields.hsfrb_assistance: Invest IN Encouraging Talent Recruitment And Development. Need To Get These Diverse Suppliers On Par With Their Competitors From A Depth And Sophistication Perspective. Invest Funds IN The Diverse Suppliers IN Our Community To Lower Their Operating Costs That Would Improve Their Costs To Us Going Forward. OR Provide A Grant To Organizations Like Ours To Subsidize The Cost Increase Of Diverse Suppliers. Compiling Consolidated Lists Of Diverse Vendors As A Guide To Organizations Can Help To Bring Awareness Of What Diverse Vendors Exist Within The Market.
fields.certifications: We Require Certification By A Recognized Third-Party And Require A Copy Of That Certification. Some Recognized Organizations Include: Local OR National Minority Supplier Development Councils Woman Owned Business Development Centers Local, State OR Federal Government Agencies Nationally Recognized Chamber Of Commerce
fields.point_of_contact: Contact Should Be Made Through The Supply Chain Category Management Team OR IN Response To A Bid Request. Potential Vendor/Suppliers Should Make Themselves Available To General Contractors And Project Managers IN Healthcare Construction.
fields.enrollment_process: IN Working With The Category Management Team, OR Construction Project Managers, The Vendor/Supplier Will Provide Documentation If Awarded As A Vendor And They Will Be Recognized IN Our 3rd Party Tool.
fields.examples_of_successes: Our Construction Teams Look To Many Of The General Contractors IN The Chicagoland Area And Discuss Those Diverse Partnerships They Have Formed. Many Of The General Contractors Have Forged Both Relationships And Programs To Help Elevate The Work Product Being Provided. Additionally, There Are Many Diverse Suppliers Who Have Grown From Being Material Passthrough Suppliers To Active Performers Of Work – Capitalizing On These Existing Relationships And Extending The Breadth Of Scope For Those Same Vendors Has Been Beneficial To All Parties.
